result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Toyan Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Toyan Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Toyan Jackson.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Scheduling Conference proceeded.
Defense's MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL; received and filed.

Defendant Toyan Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Toyan Jackson.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update regarding Discovery issue and requested date for Bail/Bond hearing. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
ORDER PERMITTING REVIEW OF DIGITAL DISCOVERY AT MILWAUKEE HOC; signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided copy to HOC.

Defendant Toyan Jackson in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Defendant Toyan Jackson in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense still in the process of receiving all Discovery materials from the State. State confirmed. Defense requesting an adjournment to allow time to review Discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for a Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Status hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Toyan Jackson in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Defendant Toyan Jackson in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Arguments heard regarding Motion to Modify Bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED  Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Defense received partial Discovery material from the State. Court ordered State and Defense to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Status hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Toyan Jackson in court with Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton; both appear by video.  Defendant Toyan Jackson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Braunreiter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toyan Jackson in Court with Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Defendant Toyan Jackson in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Defense appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. State appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Fenton was recently appointed to represent Mr. Jackson. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Toyan Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Toyan Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toyan Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Toyan Jackson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Toyan Jackson in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Toyan Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
